Name: Speed limits when passing vehicles engaged in the collection of waste.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to speed limits when passing vehicles engaged in the collection of waste.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1. Subchapter three of chapter one of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-187 to read as follows: 
§19-187 Speed limit when passing vehicles collecting waste.  The driver of a motor vehicle, upon overtaking a vehicle engaged in the collection of waste and recyclables for the department of sanitation or a vehicle engaged in the collection of waste and recyclables for a private entity licensed pursuant to section 16-505 of the code, shall not exceed a speed of ten miles per hour.
§2. This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment.

KS 
LS #2740
12/5/11
